story.kicker_image_caption: MHCET Results declared, over 2.62 students surpass examination
story.storykicker: This year, over 2.62 lakh students passed the examination with good marks.
story.storybody:
The Department of Technical Education (DTE) declared the results of the Common Entrance Test (CET) on Wednesday, June 1. This year, over 2.62 lakh students passed the examination with good marks.

As the question paper had two wrong questions in Physics as well as in Chemistry, the students scored two marks each against every wrong questions."Since none of the candidates scored zero this year, all have passed and are eligible for admission to engineering institutes. Around 53 candidates have scored above 191 out of 200 this year," Dayanand Meshram, joint director, Directorate of Technical Education (DTE), according to a report in Hindustan Times

The Physics section was lengthy while the chemistry, biology, and mathematics sections were very easy to score. (Click here to check the paper analysis)

The exam was conducted at various centres on May 5. The exam is conducted for admissions to first year of full time degree courses of Health Sciences (MBBS, BDS, BAMS, BHMS, BUMS, BPTh, BOTh, BASLP, BP&O and BSc. Nursing, B.V.Sc. & AH) and Technical Education (Engineering and Technology, Pharmacy and Pharm. D.).

About DTE:
The Department of Technical Education (DTE) was established on September 4, 1957. It runs 12 government engineering colleges, 49 polytechnic colleges, three colleges of fine art, 39 technical high schools, 17 government commercial institutes, 42 tailoring and garment making training centres and four vocational training centers.

DTE conducts Master of Technology/Master of Planning, Bachelor of Technology/Bachelor of Architecture, MFA, BFA, diploma and certificate courses through engineering colleges, polytechnics, technical high schools, commercial institutes, arts colleges, tailoring and garment making training centers and vocational training centers.

For more updates, follow India Today Education.
